intro: Micromeria guichardii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and succulent leaves. The plant thrives in arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Micromeria guichardii plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
